question:
On a recent holiday you lost a valuable item. Fortunately you have travel insurance to cover the cost of anything lost.
Write a letter to the manager of your insurance company.
-	describe the item you lost
-	explain how you lost it
-	tell the insurance company what you would like them to do.
text: I am writing this letter to inform you regarding the loss of my DSLR camera during my travel.

I lost my DSLR camera of Nikon model No. K1250 with leather case alongwith lens of 20 XD zoom. I had purchased the camera alongwith the lens online, four months ago, the copy of the purchase is enclosed herewith.

I was on a tour to the North Bengal, where I lost it. Infact, while I was travelling in the hilly road by jeep, I could not collect it back. I have made a complaint of the lost item with the nearest police station, the copy of which is also enclosed herewith for your ready reference.

As, I have taken travel insurance from your company which covers the cost of anything that is lost, I would be grateful if you could make necessary arrangement to address my claims. I am enclosing the copy of my policy for your reference.
I would be thankful for your swift response.
